title.narrative: Udvidelse af Danmarks aktieandel i Verdensbanken

description.narrative:
IBRD, the World Bank, was established in 1945 and has 188 member countries. IBRD helping to reduce poverty in middle-income and creditworthy poorer countries. IBRD surplus fund development activities in low-income countries and favorable loan terms for middle-income countries .
The latest general capital increase of the World Bank took place in 1998 when Denmark subscribed to approx. DKK 2644.1 million worth of shares of which 6 per cent corresponding to approx. DKK 158.9 million was paid. The remaining 94 per cent were pledged as guarantee capital. The distribution of shares in IBRD is based on a formula reflecting the countries in the world economy, openness, financial stability and the level of foreign reserves. The World Bank spring meeting in 2010 approved a reform of the distribution of votes that gave developing countries a greater share of the votes in the Bank. Denmark's share of the capital amounts to 0.76 per cent.
The decision on a voice reform paved the way for a further resolution on general and selective capital increase for the World Bank. In the period 2011-2016, Denmark's paid contribution amounted to DKK 190 million. The guarantee stands as non-paid.
